info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks and southwestern Lehigh Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over McKeansburg, or 7 miles east of St. Clair, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kutztown, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Topton, Shoemakersville, Lyons, Lenhartsville, Wanamakers, Ancient Oaks and Alburtis. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 28 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
